newsitem.title: CHINA: China warns U.S. to keep out of islands dispute.
newsitem.headline: China warns U.S. to keep out of islands dispute.

text.p: China hinted to the United States on Tuesday it should not intervene in a dispute over a group of islands in the East China Sea.

"This is an issue between China and Japan and no third party may intervene in this matter," Foreign Ministry spokesman Shen Guofang said at a briefing on Tuesday. He had been asked about the security pact signed in April between the United States and Japan and its possible links to the islands row.
"The U.S.-Japan security pact is a bilateral defence arrangement and cannot exceed this scope," Shen told the briefing.
"If it exceeds this bilateral scope or is targeted at the interests of a third party, then it will ... bring complicated factors into regional security," he said.
China has expressed anger at action by Japanese ultra-nationalists to put up a lighthouse this year on one of the disputed islands, known in Chinese as the Diaoyus and in Japanese as the Senkakus.
The United States has avoided comment on the validity of claims to the disputed island group, over which Beijing and Tokyo as well as Taipei all say they exercise sovereignty.
